abstract: At a panel discussion at the College Board conference in New York, college administrators defended their inflexibility. "We simply do not negotiate," one said.
snippet: At a panel discussion at the College Board conference in New York, college administrators defended their inflexibility. "We simply do not negotiate," one said.
lead_paragraph: At Purdue University, merit-based financial aid offers are final and nonnegotiable. "We put that on our Web site -- in red," said Pamela Horne, dean of admissions and associate vice provost for enrollment management at Purdue, speaking on a panel titled "Merit Aid Negotiation" on Wednesday as part of this year's College Board conference in New York.

headline.main: That Merit-Based Aid Offer Is Final, Universities Insist
